results.title: Hilary and Jackie
results.creator_credit: Oxford Film Company, Andy Paterson, Nicolas Kent and Anand Tucker
results.brief_description: This is the story of two gifted sisters who grew up in England in the 1950s and competed for musical accolade and love. Hilary was a talented flautist, but it was her sister, Jackie, who was the musical genius who went on to become one of the greatest cellists of the 20th century, while Hilary chose a simple family life in the country. The film follows their sibling rivalry in musical competition and romance, and in spite of their differences they both share common emotions, including jealousy. As Jackie struggles with her rapid rise to fame, her journey would have incredible and devastating consequences on both hers and Hilary’s lives. Cast includes Emily Watson, Rachel Griffiths, James Frain and David Morrissey.

results.title: Analyze this = Analyse this
results.creator_credit: Harold Ramis, Jane Rosenthal, Paula Weinstein, Village Roadshow Pictures and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Mob boss Paul Vitti (Robert DeNiro) is having trouble sleeping on the eve of a planned meeting between rival Mafia gangs. His anxiety soon turns into a full blown panic attack prompting the tough guy to contact psychiatrist Ben Sobel (Billy Crystal). The neurotic Sobel initially refuses to take Vitti on as a patient but soon finds that the desperate criminal doesn’t take rejection well. Director Harold Ramis uses this comedic premise effectively, parodying the mobs ‘tough guy’ ethos, while lampooning an assortment of familiar gangster films. The casting of DeNiro is a joke in itself as the actor sends up his previous film incarnations as the quintessential Mafia ‘wiseguy’. Cast also includes Lisa Kudrow, Chazz Palminteri and Joe Viterelli.

results.title: Accused
results.creator_credit: Thornton Freeland, Douglas Fairbanks, Marcel Hellman and Criterion Film Productions
results.brief_description: A British melodrama set around a Paris dance troupe and the main performers, Tony (Douglas Fairbanks Jr) and Gaby (Dolores Del Rio) Seymour. When dancer Yvette Delange (Florence Desmond) begins to direct her attentions to the somewhat unwilling Tony, a quarrel ensues between Yvette and Gaby. The sudden death by stabbing of Yvette causes suspicion to fall on Gaby and it is only when the trial takes place, the true identity of the murderer is unmasked. Cast also includes Basil Sydney, Googie Withers, Cecil Humphreys.

results.title: Nasty love = L'Amore molesto
results.creator_credit: Mario Martone, Kermit Smith, Andrea Occhipinti, Angelo Curti, Lucky Red and Teatri Uniti
results.brief_description: A woman goes to investigate her mother’s apparent suicide and ends up having to face the grim reality of her past. Amalia, the sixty-something mother of Delia, is found dead on the beach, when she should have been on her way to visit Delia in Bologna. Delia, wanting to know why her mother killed herself, journeys back to Naples to discover the truth. She encounters her mother’s supposed lover and his son, as well as her estranged father. As she continues to explore, she must face the fact that her relationship with her mother was based on jealousy and disgust as much as it was on love. She must also face up to a terrible lie she told as a child, one that questioned her mother’s fidelity and ruined the lives of everyone around her. In Italian with English subtitles. Cast includes Anna Bonaiuto, Angela Luce, Gianni Cajafa and Giovanni Viglietti.

results.title: Mare tranquilitatis
results.creator_credit: Frank Marshall, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Imagine Entertainment (US) and Clavius Base
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
It would be the culmination of John F. Kennedy’s dream. On July 20th 1969, after years of development and training, Apollo 11 - with its team of Neil Armstrong, Edward “Buzz” Aldrin Jr., and Michael Collins - is about to land a man on the moon. The world is watching, and America holds its breath as Neil Armstrong takes “one small step for man - one giant leap for mankind.”
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Marshall, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Imagine Entertainment (US) and Clavius Base

results.title: Spider
results.creator_credit: Graham Yost, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Imagine Entertainment (US) and Clavius Base
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
Before America could land on the moon, it had to devise the lunar module named “LEM” or “Spider”. From an idea on a sketch pad to design and construction; through nine years of rigorous tests, successes and failures. 1969 will witness the first ever docking of two manned vessels in space on Apollo 9, and the first flight of a lunar module in the moon’s orbit on Apollo 10. With all systems go, that same year would see the lift-off of Apollo 11.

results.title: We interrupt this program
results.creator_credit: David Frankel, Michael Bostick, Ron Howard, Brian Grazer, Imagine Entertainment (US) and Clavius Base
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “From the earth to the moon”.
On April 13, 1970, Apollo 13, the 23rd manned flight into space, developed problems that threatened the lives of the astronauts on board. The complacency which had accompanied the launch and the disinterest of the general public throughout the mission until problems occurred were quickly dispelled, as every move was monitored by journalists who fed the story to a hungry audience fast becoming hooked on sensationalism. A divide was growing wider between the traditions of the intellectual press and the fast-feed emotional content of the new tabloid journalism.

results.title: The Legend of the holy drinker
results.creator_credit: Ermanno Olmi, Vittorio Cecchi Gori, Mario Cecchi Gori, Vincenzo de Leo, Roberta Cicutto, Aura Film, Tiger Cinematografica and Cecchi Gori Group
results.brief_description: In this award winning Italian film based on the novel by Joseph Roth, Rutger Hauer plays Andreas, an ex-miner jailed for an accidental murder. Released from prison, he is living the life of an alcoholic derelict, under the bridges of Paris until he comes into contact with a stranger, who gives him 200 francs. Andreas is confident of finding work and insists that the money should be a loan only. The stranger asks that he repay the debt to the local parish priest, as soon as he is in a position to do so. Despite Andreas’ good intentions, he is continually caught up with events or old acquaintances that part him from his money, yet strangely, the 200 francs keeps reappearing back in his wallet. Cast also includes Anthony Quayle, Sandrine Dumas, Sophie Segalen and Dominique Pinon.

results.title: For a few dollars more = Per Qualche dollari in piu [Widescreen] (S)
results.creator_credit: Sergio Leone, Alberto Grimaldi, Constantin Film, Arturo Gonzales and Produzioni Europee Associati
results.brief_description: This follow-up to Sergio Leone’s “A Fistful of Dollars” brings back Clint Eastwood as the serape-clad, cigar-chewing Man With No Name. Engaged in an ongoing battle with bounty hunter Col. Douglas Mortimer, Eastwood joins forces with his enemy to capture the homicidal bandit El Indio. Musical score by Ennio Morricone. Cast includes Clint Eastwood, Lee Van Cleef, Gian Marian Volonte and Klaus Kinski.

results.title: A Fistful of dollars = Per un pugno di dollari [Widescreen] (S)
results.creator_credit: Sergio Leone, George Papi, Harry Colombo and Jolly Film
results.brief_description: Clint Eastwood plays a cynical gunfighter who comes to a small border town and offers his services to two rivalling gangs. Neither gang is aware of his double play, and each thinks it is using him, but the stranger will outwit them both. This picture was the first instalment in a cycle commonly known as the “Dollars” trilogy, with “For a Few Dollars More” and “The Good, the Bad, and the Ugly” as follow-ups. Although the plot was admittedly borrowed from Kurosawa’s “Yojimbo”, the film contains all of Leone’s trademarks; taciturn characters, precise framing, extreme close-ups, and the haunting music of Ennio Morricone. Cast includes Marianne Koch, John Wells, W. Lukschy and Josef Egger.
